com.cognifide.slice.mapper.helper

Class ReflectionHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.cognifide.slice.mapper.helper.ReflectionHelper

  • public final class ReflectionHelper
extends Object
    Contains methods mapping JCR or Sling objects to data transfer objects. Supports use of reflection mechanisms.

    • Field Summary

    • Method Detail

      • getFieldType

        public static Class<?> getFieldType(Field field)
        This method translates primitive types into their object representation. ValueMap expects non-primitive types hence the need of translation.
        Parameters:
        field - type of this field will be translated
        Returns:
        object type of the field

      • readAllDeclaredFields

        public static Field[] readAllDeclaredFields(Class<?> clazz)
        Returns an array of Field objects reflecting all the fields declared by the class or interface represented by this Class object. This includes public, protected, default (package) access, and private fields, as well as inherited fields (except for Object class). The elements in the array returned are not sorted and are not in any particular order. This method returns an array of length 0 if the class or interface declares no fields, or if this Class object represents a primitive type, an array class, or void.
        Parameters:
        clazz - class that should be queried for declared fields.=
        Returns:
        the array of Field objects representing all the declared fields of this class and super classes (except for Object class).

      • setObjectField

        public static void setObjectField(javax.jcr.Property property,
                                  Field field,
                                  Object object)
                           throws javax.jcr.RepositoryException,
                                  IllegalAccessException
        Sets given property as object's field, trying to fetch the property's value of type that matches the field best. Fields of the following types are supported by this method:
        • Boolean
        • Calendar
        • Double
        • InputStream
        • Long
        • Node
        • String
        If the property cannot be converted to field's type, a RepositoryException will be thrown. If given field cannot be assigned from any of the supported types, an IllegalArgumentException will be thrown.
        Parameters:
        property - property to be set as field's value
        field - field to be set
        object - target of the method, must contain the field
        Throws:
        javax.jcr.RepositoryException - If the property cannot be converted to field's type, or if it's multi-valued, or other repository specific error occurs.
        IllegalAccessException - if field is not accessible.
        IllegalArgumentException - if field cannot be assigned from any of the supported types.
